channel.title: Food
channel.description:
Anyway to make it so when i click on food 1000 times it will only eat 1 instead of just flying through all the food
Like have a timer so i doesnt eat like 10 at a time.

item.title: Food
item.dc:creator: @Limit101 Limit101
item.description:
@Limit101 wrote:

Ugh i know your trying to make me learn but idk wtf to do do i put it next to void or somthing.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 21, 2008, 03:55:17 pm[/size][hr]Come on please tell me

Read full topic

item.title: Food
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“Limit101, post:13, topic:232507”]I still fly through the food. I click many times and it just goes through them.

If you know the sparkz-scape base i want to be able to eat like that

I want to be able to click many times but be stopped from eating like many at once.

case 6691: //Sara Brew (1) healing[1] = 10; healing[2] = 10; healing[3] = -1; break; case 391: //Manta ray healing[1] = 30; healing[2] = 30; healing[3] = -1; foodTimer = 10; break;
Thats what it looks like[/quote]
Because he gave you the wrong method.

item.title: Food
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

I’m not going to ‘spoon-feed’ you, but I’ll tell you this;
Once you’ve declared public int foodTimer = 0;
Add;

foodTimer = ##;

Into your food methods.

Read full topic

item.title: Food
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Get rid of the;

foodTimer = 10;

It won’t actually work unless you add it to your food methods.

Read full topic

item.title: Food
item.dc:creator: @Limit101 Limit101
item.description:
@Limit101 wrote:

[code=java]

import java.io.;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;
import java.security.;

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

private void setSidebarMage() {
try {
outStream.createFrame(106);
outStream.writeByteC(6);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
} catch(Exception E) {
sendMessage(“Error switching sidebar back to the magic interface!”);
}
}

public int mageSplash = 0;
public int foodTimer = 0;
foodTimer = 10;

public void SummonNewNPC(int npcID) {
server.npcHandler.newSummonedNPC(npcID, absX, absY-1, heightLevel, absX-1, absY-1, absX+1, absY-1, 1, server.npcHandler.GetNpcListHP(npcID), false, playerId);
summonedNPCS++;
}[/code]

Have no clue where to put the just plain food timer and i added the int just under another

Read full topic

[quote=“Limit101, post:5, topic:232507”]Dude not sure what you mean. ok i added public int foodTimer = 0;
right under another int but i added the foodtimer somewhere and it says

:: Preparing for compile... :: Auto-setting envriomental variables... :: :: Scanning for latest JDK version... :: :: Found JDK 1.6.0_07 :: Results: client.java:26: <identifier> expected foodTimer = 10; ^ 1 error :: Done! Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
Where did you add it? Did you declare the int? And where did you declare it?

item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

By adding a simple timer, E.G;
But first, declare;

public int foodTimer = 0;

And then make something like this; (Not actually this big but yano)

foodTimer = 1000000000000000000000;
